intro: Araiostegia gymnocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-seeded sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and succulent leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous tiny seeds. Araiostegia gymnocarpa is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with features such as reduced leaf surface area and deep root systems to conserve water.
